Vera Baird, Northumbria's Police and Crime Commissioner (PCC), is under Ministry of Justice (MoJ) investigation for allocating over £500,000 in public funds to Victims First Northumbria, a charity she co-directs with Chief Constable Sue Sim. Critics, including Labour MP Keith Vaz, allege a conflict of interest, deeming it inappropriate for a PCC to fund an organization they oversee. Baird defended the decision, claiming adherence to MoJ protocols, while Sim (set to retire in June) faced prior bullying allegations investigated by Baird. The MoJ will assess potential conflicts of interest, threatening funding withdrawal if confirmed. Concerns also persist that Sim’s controversial history may deter crime victims from using the charity, established after its predecessor saw declining engagement.

Three people were sentenced, and two others await sentencing for the 2014 torture of Greg Valecce, 53, in a Philadelphia basement. Led by Corry Campbell (20 years), the group, including Carl Halin (20 years) and Sandra Ng (23 months), beat Valecce over 42 hours, believing he harmed Campbell’s cat and stole from them. Valecce was restrained, tattooed with offensive symbols (e.g., swastikas, slurs), and suffered broken bones. He escaped and alerted police. Evidence included a tattoo gun, drugs, and stolen items. Valecce, physically and psychologically scarred, received free tattoo removal. Two others, David Harrison and Jennifer Pratt, await sentencing and trial, respectively. Defendants pleaded guilty to charges like aggravated assault, citing troubled backgrounds during sentencing.

Manchester United have officially approached PSV Eindhoven to sign 21-year-old winger Memphis Depay, with manager Louis van Gaal (familiar from their 2014 World Cup collaboration with the Netherlands) driving the move. PSV’s technical director confirmed contact from United, PSG, and another top European club, noting higher financial offers than Tottenham’s rejected £15m bid in 2014. Depay, enjoying a standout season (20 goals in 26 league games), helped PSV secure their first Eredivisie title in seven years. His skills include pace, dribbling, and powerful shooting, though he occasionally shows youthful decision-making. Scouts and coaches, including Ed van Steijn (who compared him favorably to a young Cristiano Ronaldo) and PSV’s Phillip Cocu (likening his potential to Arjen Robben), highlight his talent. Depay also shone at the 2014 World Cup, scoring twice for the Netherlands.

Chelsea secured a 3-1 away victory over Manchester City in the first leg of the Youth Cup final, with Tammy Abraham scoring a first-half brace (his 35th and 36th goals of the season) and Dominic Solanke adding a late third. Isaac Buckley-Ricketts netted City’s lone goal. Key performances included Chelsea’s Ola Aina and Jake Clarke-Salter defensively, while City’s Brandon Barker and Tosin Adarabioyo stood out despite the loss. Abraham’s injury substitution raised concerns, and City missed chances to equalize, with Kean Bryan and Aaron Nemane failing to capitalize. The match highlighted emerging talents from both academies.

Marco Rubio asserts that individuals are born with their sexual preferences but opposes legalizing same-sex marriage as a constitutional right, arguing states should legislate marriage definitions. He stated this on CBS’s *Face the Nation*, emphasizing that courts should not decide the issue. Despite personally believing marriage is between a man and a woman, Rubio said he would attend a same-sex wedding of a loved one to show respect, comparing it to his Catholic opposition to divorce not negating his love for divorced individuals. The Florida senator, recently announcing his presidential bid, has reportedly secured substantial campaign funding ahead of a competitive Republican primary.

Pablo Mandado, a 27-year-old Spaniard, and Ilze Zebolde, a 31-year-old Latvian, quit their restaurant jobs in Manchester to embark on an open-ended, budget-friendly global cycling journey. Since departing London a year ago, they have cycled nearly 7,000 miles (11,132 km) through 16 European and Asian countries, averaging under 3 euros per person daily. They minimize costs by camping (161 nights), using hospitality platforms like Couchsurfing (66 nights) and Warmshowers (44 nights), and relying on low-cost foods (pasta, rice, seasonal produce) and occasional dumpster diving. Major expenses are food (2.74€ daily) and gear, with free accommodations and no transport costs. Their route included France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, the Balkans, Greece, Turkey, Georgia, and Armenia, with plans to cycle through Asia, the Pacific, and the Americas. Emphasizing spontaneity, they prioritize exploration over schedules, embracing "the unknown" as they continue their multi-year odyssey.

Brown emphasizes concussion education via World Rugby’s online modules, which helped him prioritize health over playing. Brown’s stance highlights rugby’s growing focus on concussion awareness. He also promotes Land Rover’s "We Deal In Real" campaign, supporting grassroots rugby.
